multiple_choice_questions.question: Which fruit is actually botanically a fruit, not a vegetable?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Tomatoes have seeds inside, which makes them fruits! Many people think they're vegetables because we use them in savory dishes.

multiple_choice_questions.question: How much protein does one large egg contain?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: One large egg contains 6 grams of complete protein with all essential amino acids!

multiple_choice_questions.question: What makes carrots good for your eyes?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Beta-carotene in carrots converts to Vitamin A, which helps keep your eyes healthy!

multiple_choice_questions.question: Which of these foods grows underground?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Sweet potatoes are root vegetables that grow underground, storing energy in their roots!

multiple_choice_questions.question: How long does it take for a pineapple to grow?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Pineapples take about 18-20 months to grow - that's why they're so special!
multiple_choice_questions.learning_point: Growing time and appreciation for food

multiple_choice_questions.question: Which food is called the 'king of fruits'?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Mangoes are called the 'king of fruits' in many countries because of their amazing sweet taste!

multiple_choice_questions.question: What part of the broccoli plant do we eat?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Broccoli is actually made of tiny flower buds that we eat before they bloom into yellow flowers!

multiple_choice_questions.question: Which protein food contains omega-3 fatty acids that are good for your brain?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Fish contains omega-3 fatty acids that help your brain grow and work well!

multiple_choice_questions.question: What makes corn kernels pop into popcorn?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Each corn kernel has a little water inside. When heated, it turns to steam and makes the kernel pop!

multiple_choice_questions.question: Which food is made from soybeans?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Tofu is made by pressing soybean milk into blocks, just like how cheese is made from cow's milk!

multiple_choice_questions.question: What color do bell peppers start as before they turn red, yellow, or orange?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: All bell peppers start green and change colors as they ripen and get sweeter!

multiple_choice_questions.question: Which fruit is mostly water and perfect for hot summer days?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Watermelons are about 90% water, making them super refreshing and hydrating!

multiple_choice_questions.question: What do lentils help put back into the soil?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Lentils and other legumes have special bacteria that put nitrogen back into the soil to help other plants grow!

multiple_choice_questions.question: Why do onions make you cry when you cut them?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Onions release a gas when cut that mixes with the water in your eyes to form a mild acid!

multiple_choice_questions.question: Which nutrient helps build strong muscles?
multiple_choice_questions.explanation: Protein is like building blocks for your muscles - it helps them grow and get stronger!

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Tomatoes are actually _______ because they have seeds inside.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: Many people think tomatoes are vegetables, but botanically they are fruits!
hints: It's not a vegetable
Think about what makes a fruit a fruit

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Broccoli looks like tiny green _______ because we eat the flower buds.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: The part of broccoli we eat is actually the flower buds before they bloom!
hints: What does broccoli look like?
Think about the shape

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Fish contains healthy _______ fatty acids that are good for your brain.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: These special fats help your brain develop and work properly!
hints: It's a type of healthy fat
It starts with 'o'

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Sweet potatoes store energy in their _______ underground.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: Root vegetables like sweet potatoes grow underground and store nutrients in their roots!
hints: What part of the plant is underground?
Where do root vegetables store food?

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: It takes almost _______ years for a pineapple to grow completely.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: Pineapples are very slow-growing fruits that require patience!
hints: It's more than 1 year
It's less than 3 years

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Carrots are good for your _______ because they contain beta-carotene.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: Beta-carotene converts to Vitamin A which helps maintain good vision!
hints: What body part benefits from Vitamin A?
What do you use to see?

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: _______ is made from soybeans and can be cooked many different ways.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: This protein-rich food is popular in many Asian cuisines!
hints: It's a soybean product
It's white and comes in blocks

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Watermelons are mostly _______ which makes them refreshing on hot days.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: About 90% of a watermelon is water!
hints: What makes up most of a watermelon?
What do you drink when thirsty?

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Bell peppers start _______ and change colors as they ripen.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: All bell peppers begin green and develop their final colors as they mature!
hints: What color are unripe peppers?
Think about the first stage

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: _______ helps build and repair muscles in your body.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: This nutrient is essential for growing strong and healthy!
hints: What nutrient builds muscles?
Found in meat, eggs, and beans

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Corn kernels pop into popcorn when _______ inside turns to steam.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: The moisture inside each kernel creates pressure that makes it pop!
hints: What liquid is inside corn kernels?
What creates steam when heated?

fill_in_the_blank_questions.question: Mangoes are called the '_______ of fruits' in many countries.
fill_in_the_blank_questions.context: This title shows how much people love this tropical fruit!
hints: What royal title shows something is the best?
Rhymes with 'ring'

true_false.question: All nuts grow on trees.
true_false.explanation: Most nuts grow on trees, but peanuts actually grow underground like potatoes!

true_false.question: Eating a rainbow of colorful fruits and vegetables gives you different nutrients.
true_false.explanation: Different colors in fruits and vegetables come from different nutrients, so eating many colors helps you get lots of vitamins!

true_false.question: Fish can only live in salt water.
true_false.explanation: Many fish live in fresh water like rivers and lakes, such as salmon and trout!
